intro: Oldenlandia praetermissa, commonly known as the "Neglected Oldenlandia," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in umbels, and it has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly waxy texture. Oldenlandia praetermissa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks.
